messages.content: Den_ComfyUI_Workflow is about using custom nodes in ComfyUI to improve the efficiency and performance of image/video and control net tasks. It includes manipulation of latent space and supports automatic pipelines with minimal effort.
What are the new nodes added in Den Workflow ComfyUI?

The new nodes added include `Den_ImageToLatentSpace` for converting images to latent space, `Den_GPTSampler_llama` for using Llama GPT samplers, `Den_GPTLoaderSimple_llama` for loading Llama GPT models, `Den_SVD_img2vid` for video generation using the SVD model, and `Den_FaceRestoreCFWithModel` for face restoration using Codeformer models.
What models can be used with ComfyUI?

The Den workflow ComfyUI supports using models from the llava and gguf libraries. Models can be placed in the following paths: 'ComfyUI\models\GPTcheckpoints\llava', 'ComfyUI\models\GPTcheckpoints\llava\clips', and 'ComfyUI\models\GPTcheckpoints\llama\clips'.
How can models be placed in ComfyUI?

Models can be added to ComfyUI by installing the Den_GPTLoaderSimple_llama and Den_GPTSampler_llama nodes. Once these nodes are installed, the model and clip can be loaded using the Den_GPTLoaderSimple_llama node and the samplers can be created using the Den_GPTSampler_llama node.
What is the purpose of the Den_SVD_img2vid node?

The Den_SVD_img2vid node is used to create videos from images by applying the SVD model. This node is useful for generating videos from image sequences by exploiting spatial and temporal correlations in the latent space.
What is the role of the Den_GPTLoaderSimple_llama node?
The Den_GPTLoaderSimple_llama node is used for loading the LLM models. It allows for the preparation of the GPT models before generating samples or building pipelines using ComfyUI.
How are custom nodes installed in ComfyUI?

Custom nodes can be installed in ComfyUI by entering the Git URL into the ComfyUI Manager and then entering the Git address. This allows for the addition of new functionalities to ComfyUI including custom nodes for image/video processing, routing, controls, and more.
